titleStmt.title: George W. Johnston to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG0996

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
PHIL. TOMPPERT Jr., CLERK.
FRED. WOBBE, DEPUTY CLERK.
Clerks' Office, Louisville City Court,
Louisville, Ky., October 23d. 1865.
His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette
Dr Sir.

Mr Gill the coroner of this county Informs me that he has applied to your Excellency to offer a reward for the apprehension of the murderers of an unknown Woman killed some few nights since in the neighborhood of this city. I learn from the facts appearing before the coroners Jury, that a most foul & outrageous murder has been committed by some persons unknown; a reward may lead to the Information that will give a refference to facts that may lead to the arrest of the Guilty parties. I respectfully reccomend that a reward be offered.

I am your obt servt
Geo W. Johnston
Ct Judge 7th Judicial District
